shortlist.name: Triple Force
shortlist.rationale: Outstanding recent form with multiple wins and placings, including a last-time-out victory. Consistency at this level, top current odds, and no sign of regression make this runner the clear form pick. Connections are in good order and the market strongly supports.

shortlist.name: Jewel Maker (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent winner two starts ago and another win in last five runs. Consistent performer at this grade, holding form well. Odds offer some value for a proven, reliable type with a strong trainer/jockey combination.

shortlist.name: Real Man
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple placings, indicating reliability and fitness. Trained by K. R. Burke, a respected handler, and partnered by Clifford Lee, a capable jockey. Odds reflect strong market confidence and suggest genuine winning chance.

shortlist.name: Fine Art Dealer (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with a promising last run and open to further improvement. Trained by William Haggas, whose runners are often well-prepared, and ridden by Jason Hart. Market support is strong, indicating expectations for a bold showing.

shortlist.name: Arnhem (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 9/4 SBK, 3.6 exchange (clear favourite, strong market support)
shortlist.rationale: Arrives in peak form with two recent runner-up finishes and a win four starts back. Consistent at this level, proven with current connections, and holds the best recent figures in the field. Market confidence is strong, suggesting stable expectations for another big run.

shortlist.name: Parisiac (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 85/40 SBK, 4.9 exchange (solid second choice in market)
shortlist.rationale: Recent winner two starts ago and generally consistent, with only one poor run in last six. Connections are in good form and the horse has shown adaptability at this level. Odds reflect genuine winning chance without being overbet.

shortlist.name: Trojan Sun
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form at this level, including a win and several placed efforts. Trained by Jim Goldie, who is reliable at this venue. Market support is strong, indicating confidence. No need for major improvement to win here.

shortlist.name: Minella Study
shortlist.rationale: Recent form figures show improvement and consistency, with two runner-up finishes in last three starts. Jason Hart is a capable jockey. Odds reflect realistic winning chance without being overbet.

shortlist.name: Spooky Wooky (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Exchange 5, SBK 11/4 – competitive in the market.
shortlist.rationale: Latest run was a close second, suggesting readiness to win at this level. Consistent profile and market position indicate genuine claims. Connections are competent and the horse does not require significant improvement.

shortlist.name: Jannas Journey (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 11/4 SBK, 3.8 exchange (clear market leader, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Comes in with a strong, consistent profile—multiple recent wins and only one unplaced effort in last seven starts. Remains in form and is trained locally by Jim Goldie, who has a good record at Musselburgh. Market support is strong, indicating confidence from connections and punters.

shortlist.name: Lexington Belle (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Solid each-way profile with several placed efforts this season. Recent form suggests she is holding her level and could be suited by conditions. Jason Hart is a reliable jockey, and Alice Haynes is a trainer in good form. Odds indicate she is respected in the market.

shortlist.name: Carolus Magnus (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form, with three top-six finishes in last five starts. Trainer and jockey have solid records at this level. Odds represent fair value for a horse with proven ability to compete in this grade.

shortlist.name: Monhammer
shortlist.rationale: Has hit the frame in three of last four starts, showing clear improvement. Mulrennan is a top northern rider and Perratt’s horses often run well at this track. Odds are justified given recent consistency and upward trend.

shortlist.name: Giselles Izzy (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Won two starts ago and placed in three of last six. Trainer and jockey are in form. Recent win and consistent placings suggest she is capable of winning again without needing to improve significantly. Odds are slightly generous for her profile.

shortlist.name: Freak Encounter (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer at this level with several recent placings; current exchange odds indicate strong market support. Connections are capable at this grade and the horse is holding form well, suggesting readiness to win.

shortlist.name: Alpine Sierra (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Has been running in better company and now drops to a more suitable level. Recent form figures flatter to deceive but has shown ability in stronger races. Trainer and jockey are a proven combination at Musselburgh.

shortlist.name: Carlton And Co
shortlist.rationale: Consistent in the frame and has already won at this level this season. Reliable profile and connections in good form; odds are fair for a horse with proven ability in similar contests.

shortlist.name: Thunderstorm Katie
shortlist.rationale: Recent form shows consistency with a mix of mid-field and top-five finishes. The odds offer good value for a horse with proven ability to compete at this level.

shortlist.name: Ski Angel
shortlist.rationale: Form indicates a strong recent performance with a win and several top-five finishes. The odds reflect a competitive chance.

shortlist.name: Beerwah (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent form with several top-five finishes. The odds suggest a strong contender with a good jockey-trainer combination.

shortlist.name: Ride Like A Girl (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent form figures (231-3) show a horse operating at a high level, with a recent third suggesting she is still in peak condition. The combination of a top jockey and trainer, plus a short price, reflects market confidence. No major improvement needed—she is the one to beat.

shortlist.name: Ninna Collina
shortlist.rationale: Consistent placed efforts (3233-) indicate a reliable performer who is rarely far away. The odds offer some value against the favourite, and the trainer/jockey combination is solid. Likely to run her race again, but needs to find a bit more to win.

shortlist.name: Lady Kara
shortlist.rationale: Unexposed with only three runs, all in the frame (232). Could still have improvement to come, but already shows a high level of ability. The odds are fair given potential upside, but she must prove she can handle the favourite.

shortlist.name: Jackstell (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Recent win and consistent form suggest strong potential. The trainer-jockey combination is also noteworthy.

shortlist.name: Big Boy Barney (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent second-place finish indicates good form, though consistency is a concern.

shortlist.name: Jimmyjeroo
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple placings and a win in last 8 starts. Connections are solid, and current odds indicate strong market confidence. No signs of decline in form, and profile fits well for this grade and trip.

shortlist.name: Designer Destiny (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Lightly raced with some promise shown in previous runs. Sean Bowen is a notable jockey booking, and Tim Vaughan is a capable trainer. Odds suggest respect from the market, and recent form is competitive for this level.

shortlist.name: Jager Time (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with a strong second last time out, indicating peak fitness. Trained by Fergal O'Brien, a respected yard, and partnered by a capable jockey. Market support is strong, suggesting confidence from connections and punters. No signs of decline in form and holds the best combination of recent performance and connections.

shortlist.name: Jungle Wood (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: 9/4 SBK, 3.3 exchange (solid second choice in market)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with two wins and a third from last three starts, showing clear improvement and reliability. Sean Bowen is a top jockey, adding further confidence. Recent form is strong and the horse is holding condition well, making this runner a logical contender.

shortlist.name: Ballintubber Boy (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form at this level, proven ability to win and place, and represents a top stable with strong course record. Odds reflect market confidence and suggest he is the one to beat.

shortlist.name: Jeudidee (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Ultra-consistent profile with recent wins and placings, holding form well. Connections are reliable at this level and odds indicate strong market respect. Should be in the mix based on current form and stable/jockey combination.

shortlist.name: Ballynaheer (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form shows consistent performance with a strong finish in the last race, indicating good current form.

shortlist.name: Born At Midnight
shortlist.rationale: Has shown strong form in the past and is well-supported in the market, suggesting potential for a good run.

shortlist.name: Northern Rose (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent form with multiple placed efforts, including a recent second. Trainer and jockey have solid strike rates at this level. Odds represent fair value for a horse that is regularly competitive and does not need to improve significantly to win.

shortlist.name: Prairie Queen
shortlist.rationale: Recent form shows signs of improvement, with a fifth and a second in last two completed starts. Trainer is capable with this type, and the odds offer value for a horse that is trending upwards and does not need a career-best to win.

shortlist.name: My Virtue
shortlist.rationale: Consistent in recent runs, finishing in the frame in four of last five starts. Trainer is in form, and the horse is proven at this level. Odds are fair for a horse that is reliable and does not need to find much more.

shortlist.name: Bowood
shortlist.rationale: Consistent form and favorable odds make Bowood a strong contender. The recent form shows a mix of places and unplaced finishes, but the odds suggest market confidence.

shortlist.name: Super Hit (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form indicates some consistency with a couple of fourth-place finishes. The odds are competitive, and the jockey-trainer combination is noteworthy.

shortlist.name: Foreseen
shortlist.rationale: Consistent form with several places recently. The odds are slightly higher than Bowood but still competitive, indicating potential value.

shortlist.name: Luzon Heights
shortlist.rationale: Recent form shows improvement with a win in the last race, strong jockey-trainer combination, and favorable odds.

shortlist.name: Urgent Call (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Competitive odds at 4.1 on Betfair Exchange
shortlist.rationale: Consistent form and decent odds make it a viable contender, though it lacks a recent win.

shortlist.name: Spiritoftheblues
shortlist.rationale: Recent winner, in-form connections, and a top jockey. The '1' in form indicates a last-start victory, suggesting current fitness and confidence. Odds are fair for a horse with proven recent ability and strong stable form.

shortlist.name: Lizzana (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent form with a last-start second, indicating the horse is racing well and may be ready to win. Trainer and jockey are reliable, and the odds offer value for a horse with solid recent performances.

shortlist.name: Myrrh
shortlist.rationale: Form figures of '31' show two strong recent runs, including a win and a close third. Trainer is in good form, and the exchange odds are generous for a horse with proven ability. Worth considering for value.

shortlist.name: Shebara
shortlist.rationale: No recent form, but top jockey and trainer combination. Odds reflect market respect, but lack of recent runs is a slight concern. Still, connections are strong enough to include in the shortlist.

shortlist.name: Fort Rock
shortlist.rationale: Trained by Charlie Appleby, a renowned trainer with a strong record. Although form is not listed, the odds suggest market confidence.

shortlist.name: Exotic Baby
shortlist.rationale: Recent form of 51 indicates some consistency. Trainer George Boughey has shown ability with similar types.

shortlist.name: Princling
shortlist.rationale: William Haggas is a respected trainer, and the odds suggest Princling is well-regarded despite missing form details.

shortlist.name: Welljudged
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form, strong connections, and a top jockey. The horse is proven at this level and is the clear market leader, suggesting confidence from both connections and punters. No major improvement needed—just needs to repeat recent effort.

shortlist.name: Sapphire Princess
shortlist.rationale: Consistent, reliable form with multiple placed efforts. The horse is knocking on the door and is overdue a win. The jockey and trainer are both in good form, and the odds offer value for a horse with this level of consistency.

shortlist.name: Thaisa
shortlist.rationale: Respected connections and a top jockey, but recent form is patchy. The horse would need to improve significantly on recent efforts, which is possible but not guaranteed. Odds are fair for the risk.

shortlist.name: Shallow
shortlist.rationale: Consistently competitive at this level, recent form includes a win and several close finishes. Top jockey booking and strong market support indicate confidence. No major negatives in profile.

shortlist.name: Jettie's Run (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 11/2 SBK, 6.2 exchange (solid second tier in market)
shortlist.rationale: Lightly raced with progressive profile; placed on seasonal return and has scope to improve. Trainer in good form, and jockey is reliable. Market position suggests respect.

shortlist.name: Sportingsilvermine (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple placings, suggesting reliability and readiness to win. Top jockey booking and strong market support indicate confidence from connections and punters. No sign of decline in form and holds the best profile among the field for a breakthrough win.

shortlist.name: Crystal Mariner (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent win and second suggest peak form and ability to handle current conditions. Profile shows improvement and adaptability. Market position reflects respect, and connections are capable at this level.

shortlist.name: Gunship (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 15/4 (SBK), 4.5 (exchange) – respected in market, not an outsider
shortlist.rationale: Earlier season form includes a win and two placings, and top jockey booking is a positive. Recent runs below best but retains ability and could bounce back with class edge. Market support suggests not dismissed by connections.

shortlist.name: Sir William (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 5/2 SBK, 2.52 exchange (clear market leader, strong support)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple placings and wins, suggesting reliability and peak fitness. Trained by William Haggas, a top yard, and partnered with a capable jockey. Market support confirms strong expectations. No signs of decline in form, and profile fits a typical winner at this level.

shortlist.name: Blast The Dream
shortlist.odds_note: 2/1 SBK, 4 exchange (solid second choice, some exchange drift)
shortlist.rationale: Very consistent profile with two wins and several recent placings, indicating ongoing competitiveness. Trained by Roger Varian, another leading trainer, and Jack Mitchell is a reliable jockey. Slight exchange drift but still well clear of outsiders. Form and connections suggest a strong chance if main rival underperforms.

shortlist.name: Jet Black
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with three wins and two places from last six starts. Top jockey and trainer combination. Odds represent fair value for a horse in peak form and proven at this level.

shortlist.name: Pergola (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Reliable form with multiple recent placings, including a win. Haggas/Fallon is a strong team. Slightly shorter odds but justified by consistency and connections.

shortlist.name: Safe And Sound
shortlist.rationale: Lightly raced but from a top yard. Form figures suggest improvement is possible, and Gosden runners often progress with racing. Exchange odds offer some value if ready to step forward.

shortlist.name: Ya Karim (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Market leader with solid recent third-place finish. Well-supported in betting markets indicates stable confidence. Proven form advantage over debutants in field. Rodriguez partnering for in-form Charlton yard.

shortlist.name: Devil's Peak
shortlist.rationale: Gosden/Havlin partnership brings top-tier connections. Recent fourth at better class level suggests this represents easier assignment. Form pattern shows progression despite mixed placings. Value alternative to favorite.

shortlist.name: Pentonville
shortlist.rationale: Well-backed debutant from powerful Boughey stable. Loughnane's presence suggests yard expectation. Market support (7/2) for first-timer indicates strong home preparation. Represents value against exposed rivals.

shortlist.name: Calafiori
shortlist.rationale: Consistent, progressive form with recent wins and places. Top connections in Boughey and Loughnane. Odds reflect strong chance but still represent value for a horse in this form.

shortlist.name: Lord Harcourt
shortlist.rationale: Showed clear improvement last time out (2nd), suggesting he is coming to hand. Respected trainer/jockey combo. Odds are fair for a horse with clear upward trajectory.

shortlist.name: Smiley Face (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Showed promise on debut with a close fourth, now expected to improve for a top yard. Market support is strong, and the booking of Billy Loughnane is notable. Connections are in form and the horse has the best proven form in the field.

shortlist.name: Ballybunion (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Improved from debut to finish second last time, indicating progression. Trained by Michael Bell, who has a good record with juveniles at this track. Form is solid and odds are fair for an each-way or win play.

shortlist.name: Your Love
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with three placings in last four starts. Market leader suggests strong stable confidence. Richard Spencer yard in good form and George Wood booking adds weight.

shortlist.name: Trafalger
shortlist.rationale: Strong last-time-out second shows current form cycle peaking. Consistent placing record with multiple thirds. Eve Johnson Houghton stable handles this grade well and Charles Bishop is an accomplished jockey.

shortlist.name: Smooth Silesie (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Strong early season form showing multiple wins and places. Pat Cosgrave is a top-tier jockey whose booking signals strong intent. Recent seventh may represent bounce factor after sustained good runs, but class evident.

shortlist.name: Ironist (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with a win and two places in last four starts. Trainer and jockey have solid strike rates at this level. Odds are fair for a horse in current form and with proven connections.

shortlist.name: Nacho Nacho Nacho (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form is mixed but has shown ability to compete at this level. Jockey and trainer are capable, and odds are reasonable for a horse with upside. Needs to confirm recent improvement but is respected in this company.

shortlist.name: Dandy Dinmont (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with multiple placed efforts in recent starts. Trainer and jockey are experienced, and odds offer value for a horse with solid each-way claims. Not the most progressive but reliable at this level.

shortlist.name: Itraaq
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form in the frame, representing a top yard with a leading jockey. Short odds reflect strong market confidence and suitability for this grade. No major improvement needed; expected to be at peak.

shortlist.name: King's Castle (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Solid recent form with three consecutive placings after back-to-back wins earlier in the season. Proven consistency and ability to compete at this level. Represents a capable stable; odds offer fair value against the favourite.

shortlist.name: Duffus Castle
shortlist.rationale: Recent win two starts back and followed up with a close second, indicating peak form and consistency. Shoemark is a reliable jockey, and McBride has a good record with similar types. Odds offer value for a runner with proven current ability.

shortlist.name: Lady Kameko
shortlist.rationale: Solid recent form with a runner-up finish last time, suggesting she is in good shape and competitive at this level. Cosgrave is an experienced jockey, and Pearce's horses often run well at Yarmouth. Market support is notable.

shortlist.name: Valkyrja
shortlist.odds_note: 8/1 SBK, 4.6 Exchange (market respect, not a longshot)
shortlist.rationale: Improving profile with a pair of placed efforts recently, showing ability to compete in this grade. Connections are capable, and odds are fair for a runner with upward trajectory.

shortlist.name: Galley Point (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 7/4 SBK, 3.0 exchange (clear favourite, strong market support)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with a recent 4th and 8th in maiden company, now facing a modest field. Short odds reflect strong market confidence. Connections are competent and the horse is open to further improvement after only two starts.

shortlist.name: Teffian Warrior (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 15/4 SBK, 2.32 exchange (well-backed, second choice in market)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent runs in similar grade, with market support suggesting expected improvement. Jockey/trainer combination is reliable at this level. Form is solid for the grade and odds indicate strong win prospects.

shortlist.name: Hexagonal (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 3/1 SBK, 3.95 exchange (third in market, not dismissed)
shortlist.rationale: Lightly raced with a 7th and 4th in maidens, showing ability and likely to improve. Top jockey booking (C. T. Keane) is a notable positive. Market position and connections suggest a competitive chance if progressing.

shortlist.name: Spanish Temptress (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form figures (991) show a clear upward trajectory, with two wins in last three starts. C. T. Keane is a top Irish jockey, and the trainer is in form. Odds are fair for a horse in peak condition and not needing major improvement.

shortlist.name: Ribee (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form (013), including a win and a third in last three runs. Trainer and jockey are reliable at this level. Odds represent solid each-way value for a horse proven at the trip and track.

shortlist.name: Counterculture
shortlist.rationale: Form is mixed but has shown ability to win and place at this level. Trainer is respected, and the horse is not far off its best. Odds are fair for a horse with proven class, though recent runs suggest minor improvement needed.

shortlist.name: Nibras Rainbow (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with two consecutive runner-up finishes, indicating readiness to win. Trained by Cromwell, a respected yard, and holding strong market support. No need for major improvement to contend.

shortlist.name: Late Night Talking (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form shows a return to peak with a close second and then a solid effort in a competitive field. Top jockey booking in C. T. Keane and strong market support suggest connections expect a big run.

shortlist.name: La Tulipe Noire (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent winner, indicating current form and ability to handle similar company. Odds have shortened, suggesting market confidence. No major improvement required to be competitive again.

shortlist.name: Racing Royalty
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer at this level, with several recent placings. Booking of W. J. Lee is a positive. Market position reflects realistic winning chance without needing to step up significantly.

shortlist.name: Down To Business
shortlist.rationale: Recent form shows consistency with a third-place finish, and the odds suggest strong market support.

shortlist.name: Mocking (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Form indicates a strong recent performance with several places, and the trainer-jockey combination is experienced.

shortlist.name: Mcloughlin (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form shows promise with consistent finishes, though not as strong as the top two contenders.

shortlist.name: Glenroyal (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 6/4 SBK, 2.34 exchange (solid favourite, not a longshot)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form is excellent, with two wins in last four starts and a strong win last time out. Trained by Joseph O'Brien, a top Irish trainer, and partnered with a leading jockey. Consistent at this class and trip, and current odds reflect strong market support.

shortlist.name: Local Lad (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form, always in the mix and running to a reliable level. Connections are solid, and the horse is likely to be peaking after two runs this season. Odds indicate strong market confidence and he does not need major improvement to contend.

shortlist.name: Gotta Catch'em All (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Strong favourite on exchange (2.66), joint shortest on sportsbook (3/1)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with a string of runner-up finishes, indicating reliability and readiness to win. Remains at a competitive mark and is holding form well, with market support confirming strong chance. No signs of regression in profile.

shortlist.name: Coul Dreamer (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Second choice in market (3.9 exchange, 3/1 sportsbook)
shortlist.rationale: Returned from a break with a solid second, suggesting fitness and potential for improvement. Consistent profile and top connections; market respect is notable. Should be sharper for latest run and is well placed at this level.

shortlist.name: Je T'ai Porte (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Lightly raced this season but has shown ability in previous campaigns. Trainer in good form and market support is significant. If fit after layoff, has the class to be involved.

shortlist.name: Forlio
shortlist.rationale: Returned to winning form last time out, indicating peak condition. Top jockey booking and strong market support reinforce confidence. Consistent at this level and no need for major improvement.

shortlist.name: Nancee Spain (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with two recent runner-up finishes, suggesting a win is imminent. Form is improving and odds reflect strong market respect. Connections capable at this level.

shortlist.name: Dont Do Dramas (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent runner-up effort signals return to form. Odds have contracted on the exchange, indicating market confidence. Capable of building on latest effort without needing major improvement.

shortlist.name: Labelle Mans (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Prominent in early exchange and bookmaker markets; not a longshot.
shortlist.rationale: Represents a top French jumps yard (Y. Fouin) and is partnered by leading jockey Kevin Nabet, both of whom have strong records at Fontainebleau. Market support suggests stable confidence. Connections are notably reliable in these conditions.

shortlist.name: Lady Du Seuil (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Well found in the market; not an outsider.
shortlist.rationale: From the respected M. Seror yard, which is adept with young jumpers at this venue. Jockey Charles Clayeux is experienced and often rides for the stable's best prospects. Market position indicates expectation of a strong run.

shortlist.name: Lutt Matten (Ger)
shortlist.odds_note: Short in the betting; not a longshot.
shortlist.rationale: Represents a stable with a growing reputation for readying German-bred horses for French hurdles. Jockey booking is positive, and market support is notable. No major negatives on profile.

shortlist.name: Grand Discours (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Trainer Giada Menato might have a strong contender if recent form is good, and the jockey-trainer combination is effective.

shortlist.name: Le Pere Celeste (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Mathieu Pitart's training could be a factor if the horse has shown recent improvement or consistency.

shortlist.name: Magique Mirage (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Prominent in early exchange and bookmaker markets; not a longshot.
shortlist.rationale: Represents the leading jumps yard in France (Nicolle) and is partnered by top jockey Kevin Nabet, both of whom have a strong record at Fontainebleau. Market support is notable, and connections are highly respected for readying debutants and young hurdlers.

shortlist.name: Mondoctor Jem (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Well found in the market; not considered an outsider.
shortlist.rationale: From the powerful Lageneste & Macaire stable, which excels with young jumpers at this venue. Lucas Zuliani is a reliable stable jockey. The yard’s runners are typically well-prepared for debut and early starts, and market signals are positive.

shortlist.name: Mon Vieux Jean
shortlist.odds_note: Short in the betting; clear market respect.
shortlist.rationale: Gabriel Leenders is a leading trainer of young French jumpers, and this runner is attracting early market support. The booking of Theo Dumouch is notable, and the stable’s juveniles often run well first time out.

shortlist.name: Mais Oui Madrik (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Prominent in early market; not a longshot.
shortlist.rationale: Represents a top French jumps yard with a strong record at Fontainebleau. Felix de Giles is a reliable jockey for the stable, and the horse is well found in the market, suggesting stable confidence.

shortlist.name: Gemma Invicta (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Solid market support; not a longshot.
shortlist.rationale: David Cottin is one of the leading trainers in France, and Johnny Charron is a trusted stable jockey. The horse is well backed, indicating positive expectations from connections.

shortlist.name: Neuviemme (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Short in the market; not a longshot.
shortlist.rationale: Stablemate to Gemma Invicta, also from the Cottin yard. Market position suggests strong stable confidence and potential ability, with connections proven at this venue.

shortlist.name: Gibralfaro (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Consistently trades at or near the top of the market on French exchanges; not a longshot.
shortlist.rationale: Represents the leading jumps yard of Francois Nicolle, who is highly respected at Fontainebleau. The booking of Felix de Giles is a positive, as he is a top jockey for the stable. Nicolle-trained runners at this venue are often well-prepared and attract market support.

shortlist.name: Glasgow Du Berlais (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Prominent in early betting; not considered an outsider.
shortlist.rationale: From the powerful Lageneste & Macaire team, who have an outstanding record with young jumpers at this track. Lucas Zuliani is a stable jockey and rides many of their best prospects. Yard's runners are typically forward on debut or after a break.

shortlist.name: Icare Du Seuil (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Short in the market; respected by bookmakers and exchanges.
shortlist.rationale: James Reveley is a multiple French champion jockey and rarely rides for Seror unless the horse is considered a strong contender. The combination is notable and the market support is significant.

shortlist.name: Numerus Borget (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Well found in the market; not a longshot.
shortlist.rationale: Bertrand Lestrade is a top French jumps jockey and his booking signals intent. Satalia's runners are often competitive in these Fontainebleau events, and Numerus Borget is not dismissed by the market.

shortlist.name: Leading Raffles (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: High-profile jockey Bryony Frost booking suggests strong stable confidence. Frost's presence typically indicates genuine winning chance and represents professional connections worthy of serious consideration in French provincial racing.

shortlist.name: Coute Que Coute (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Experienced British jockey James Reveley aboard suggests trainer Hugo Merienne targeting this race seriously. Quality rider bookings in French racing often signal market confidence and solid preparation.

shortlist.name: L'amie Larissa (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Second Hugo Merienne runner with competent local jockey. Dual representation from quality stable suggests strong hand in race and tactical options. Trainer confidence evident through multiple entries.
